items.title: Panthers S Tre'von Moehrig's one-game suspension upheld
items.summary: Appeals officer Derrick Brooks has upheld Panthers safety Tre'von Moehrig's one-game suspension for punching 49ers wide receiver Jauan Jennings in the groin, the NFL announced Wednesday night.

items.title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
items.summary: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 13. We also picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

items.summary: Here's everything you need to know for the NFL's full Thanksgiving slate.

items.title: There’s heightened urgency for Colts, Daniel Jones to regain earlier successes
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – There will be no lack of urgency Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium. The only real issue: Which team feels it more? The Indianapolis Colts? They’ll be home for the first time in 36 days and it’s not a stretch to insist a team that has lost two of its last three – remember [...]

items.title: Has Daniel Jones reverted against the blitz, or is it merely a blip?
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — The Indianapolis Colts have lost two of their last three games, with their most recent loss coming against the Kansas City Chiefs in overtime after surrendering an 11-point 4th quarter lead. Most notably, Indy’s highly efficient offense has simmered down over the past month or so, culminating in a collective collapse across […]

items.title: Sack record tracker: Cleveland's Myles Garrett on pace for NFL single-season record
items.summary: The Browns star has 18 sacks so far. Can he catch Michael Strahan's and T.J. Watt's record of 22.5 sacks?

items.title: Kenny Moore II, inspired by Colts' Kicking the Stigma campaign, opens up about his mental health: 'It's given me the vulnerability to speak up'
items.summary: Moore will be among the many Colts players and staff to represent Kicking the Stigma in the Colts' My Cause, My Cleats game on Sunday.

items.title: Colts' confidence in Daniel Jones, offense not shaken by 2 losses in last 3 games
items.summary: While the Colts have lost two of their last three games, they still control their destiny in the AFC South – and remain supremely confident in quarterback Daniel Jones' ability to continue to win games this season.

items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts (8-3) and Houston Texans (6-5) are heading in separate directions. The Colts have lost two of three while the Texans have won three in a row and look forward to the return of quarterback CJ Stroud. items.summary: Art Rooney Sportsmanship Award nominees are chosen for their demonstration of on-field sportsmanship.

items.title: Colts, Irsays to highlight nonprofits, causes with 'My Cause My Cleats'
items.summary: Close to 70 Indianapolis Colts players – as well as the Irsay family, General Manager Chris Ballard and Head Coach Shane Steichen and others – will wear customized cleats and shoes that highlight charitable organizations in Indiana and beyond during this season’s My Cause My Cleats game this Sunday vs. the Houston Texans.

items.title: Believe it or not, Colts fans have a lot to be thankful for
items.summary: Writing this on the heels of a disappointing loss makes the sentiment that fans of the Indianapolis Colts have plenty to be thankful for this year a more challenging prospect, but that doesn’t change the facts. While the footing may have become uneven, the Colts are still leading the AFC South and are in the […]

items.title: GAMEDAY ALERT: Road closures and delays expected for Colts fans
items.summary: Capitol Ave southbound closure through 2026 will affect all remaining Indianapolis Colts games at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Five former Colts named Semifinalists for Pro Football HoF Class of 2026
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts have five former players named among the 26 modern-era semfinalists for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2026: running back Frank Gore, defensive end/outside linebacker Robert Mathis, quarterback Philip Rivers, placekicker Adam Vinatieri, and wide receiver Reggie Wayne. Both Gore (2015-17) and Rivers (2020) had short stints in Indianapolis, and […]

items.title: Colts make roster moves with WR Ashton Dulin missing multiple weeks with injury
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts announced on Tuesday that wide receiver Ashton Dulin (hamstring) has been placed on injured reserve, and the team signed veteran safety George Odum to the 53-man active roster from the practice squad in a corresponding roster move. The Colts also re-signed released cornerback Cameron Mitchell back to the team’s practice squad. Dulin […]

items.title: Colts place Ashton Dulin on IR
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts have lost Ashton Dulin for at least the next four games. The versatile veteran has been placed on the injured reserve list after suffering a hamstring injury in Sunday’s 23-20 overtime loss to the Kansas City Chiefs. Dulin’s absence will impact two areas. He provides quality depth at wide receiver [...]

items.title: Report: Lou Anarumo an early target in Giants’ head coach search
items.summary: According to NFL Insider Josina Anderson, a league source claims Indianapolis Colts defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo is expected to receive legitimate consideration for the New York Giants’ head coach opening. A league source says Colts defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo is expected to receive strong consideration for the Giants head coach vacancy this upcoming cycle, while […]

items.title: Colts control destiny in AFC South, but back-loaded schedule against Texans, Jaguars means division will be decided in final 6 weeks of 2025 season
items.summary: Four of the Colts final six games are against the two AFC South teams – the Houston Texans and Jacksonville Jaguars – chasing them in the standings.

items.title: After three straight subpar performances, is the Colts’ panic meter starting to climb?
items.summary: If you ask Shane Steichen or any of the players if this is the time to panic, the answer would be a resounding “no”. After starting the season 7-1, the Indianapolis Colts find themselves at 8-3. In a vacuum, 8-3 is pretty good. Considering where this team was projected to be, 8-3 is fantastic. It […]

items.title: Reggie Wayne, Adam Vinatieri, Robert Mathis lead Colts as Hall of Fame reaches semifinal stage
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The road to Canton continues to narrow, and several former Indianapolis Colts remain on the journey. Three franchise icons – Reggie Wayne, Adam Vinatieri and Robert Mathis – along with Frank Gore and Philip Rivers are among 26 modern-era Semifinalists for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2026. The process to [...]

items.title: Colts’ Stock Up/Down: Week 12 @Chiefs
items.summary: Stock Up Laiatu Latu This has been Latu’s breakout year after a somewhat pedestrian rookie season. Through just 10 starts (missed one with an injury), Latu has 44 total pressures with an 18.1% win rate, 6 sacks, and added three interceptions dropping into coverage. Against the Chiefs, Latu had an interception on a tipped ball […]

items.title: Colts–Texans Showdown ist das Highlight der Week 13 Coverage bei RTL
items.summary: Das NFL-Programm von RTL in Week 13 rückt mit einem hochkarätigen Duell in der AFC South in den Mittelpunkt, wenn die Indianapolis Colts am 30. November die Houston Texans im Lucas Oil Stadium empfangen.

items.title: Colts’ Shane Steichen on Daniel Jones’ fibula: ‘He’s out there . . . he’s good to go’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Whatever was off with the Indianapolis Colts’ offense Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium – and it most definitely wasn’t up to snuff – apparently wasn’t a result of Daniel Jones’ fibula injury. Monday afternoon, Shane Steichen offered only a superficial assessment of Jones’ health status, which became an issue during practice last week as [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Shane Steichen addresses late-game offensive slide, issues pop up on first down rushes, evaluating Charvarius Ward Sr. and Sauce Gardner in Week 12 loss to Kansas City Chiefs
items.summary: The Colts' 23-20 loss to the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday dropped them to 8-3 on the season. Here are five key takeaways from Week 12:

items.summary: Colts Ring of Honor wide receiver Bill Brooks offers his thoughts on the Colts’ loss to the Kansas City Chiefs and how the team should approach the final stretch of the regular season.

items.summary: The Colts remain in first place in the AFC South, but the Jaguars are right on their heels after Week 12.

items.title: Colts, IHSAA honor high school 'Officiating Crew of the Month' for November
items.summary: This month's crew exemplifies a deep commitment to their communities, not only through officiating but also through meaningful service.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 443: Big Letdown from Colts in KC
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts contained the Kansas City Chiefs for much of the game but couldn't muster enough offense--or defensive stops--to prevail at Arrowhead Stadium. In this edition of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, Matt Adams recaps the game and explores where the Colts fell short.

items.title: FOX59/CBS4 sits down with Colts owner Carlie Irsay-Gordon for exclusive conversation
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Carlie Irsay-Gordon’s last six months have packed a punch. "You’re never really ready to lose a parent," said Irsay-Gordon. "It’s been sad, but honestly now I just wish he could physically be here now. I’m sure he’s very happy right now." Losing her father, Jim Irsay, has been hard, but he trained Irsay-Gordon [...]

items.title: Colts’ offense disappeared in OT loss to Chiefs: ’Not up to our standards’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Go ahead, blame the defense all you want. And there’s ample evidence. It failed to protect an 11-point fourth-quarter lead. It allowed Patrick Mahomes to spin his legendary late magic. The two-time MVP and three-time Super Bowl champion directed desperate Kansas City to Harrison Butker’s 25-yard field goal as time expired in regulation [...]

items.title: After overtime loss to Chiefs, Colts feel close but 'not there yet'
items.summary: The Colts, on both sides of the ball, came away from Sunday's loss to the Kansas City Chiefs feeling like they didn't make enough critical, high-leverage plays to beat a team with a Hall of Fame-level coach and quarterback.

items.title: Colts head coach Shane Steichen on offensive issues in Week 12 loss to Chiefs: 'It starts with me'
items.summary: The Colts went three-and-out on their final four offensive possessions in Sunday's 23-20 overtime loss to the Kansas City Chiefs.

items.title: Colts fail to outlast the Chiefs, fall 23-20 in Kansas City
items.summary: KANSAS CITY, Mo. — After a fast start, the Colts were stifled in the second half as they were defeated by Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium. After the Colts failed to score on their first possession, Laiatu Latu intercepted a Mahomes pass deep in Chiefs territory to set [...]

items.title: Colts offense stalls, 11-point fourth quarter lead evaporates in overtime loss to Kansas City Chiefs
items.summary: The Colts lost, 23-20, to the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday at GEHA Field at Arrowhead Stadium, falling to 8-3 on the season.

items.summary: The Colts made the roster moves on Saturday.

items.title: Charvarius Ward thought career might be over after concussion, but now ‘I feel like me again. I feel like Mooney’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Charvarius Ward didn’t need to see the video detailing events that left him with a concussion and lingering, serious symptoms that had him questioning whether he would ever play again. “I experienced it,’’ the Indianapolis Colts’ veteran cornerback said Friday. Ward called his collision with teammate Drew Ogletree freaky while each was going [...]

items.title: Colts CB Charvarius Ward Sr. on return from concussion: 'I feel like me again'
items.summary: Charvarius Ward Sr. cleared concussion protocol this week and is line to return against the Kansas City Chiefs in his first game since sustaining a concussion he described as "scary" prior to the Colts' Week 6 win over the Arizona Cardinals.

items.title: Daniel Jones, Charvarius Ward full go for Colts’ trip to Kansas City
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The quarterback and cornerback are good to go. As the Indianapolis Colts eye Sunday’s showdown with the Kansas City Chiefs in Arrowhead Stadium, they’ll have the services of Daniel Jones and Charvarius Ward. Jones was a full participant Friday’s practice after being limited Thursday when he experienced discomfort with his fibula. The Colts [...]

items.title: Colts-Chiefs preview: With Charvarius Ward Sr. back and Sauce Gardner settled in, Colts' secondary prepared for challenge of Patrick Mahomes, Andy Reid in Week 12
items.summary: Colts cornerback Charvarius Ward Sr. cleared concussion protocol, meaning he's set to play opposite Sauce Gardner against the Kansas City Chiefs in Week 12.

items.title: Daniel Jones 'ready to go' for Week 12's game vs. Kansas City Chiefs
items.summary: Jones popped up on the Colts' practice report as a limited participant in Thursday's practice, but he was a full participant Friday and will play Sunday against the Chiefs.

items.title: Colts do not rule out any players for Week 12 game vs. Kansas City Chiefs; CB Charvarius Ward Sr. clears concussion protocol
items.summary: The Colts opened Ward's 21-day window to be activated from injured reserve on Wednesday, and Ward participated in all three practices this week.

items.title: Indianapolis Colts: My Cause My Cleats
items.summary: When the Indianapolis Colts take the field on Nov. 30 against the Houston Texans, their shoes will stand out. Players will sport unique footwear as part of the NFL's My Cause My Cleats program. Expect unusual color combinations and charities close to players' hearts. The Colts' Larra Overton joined FOX59 News to talk about the [...]

items.title: Despite expanding game, the superpower of Colts’ Alec Pierce is getting deep
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Listen to those around him, and Alec Pierce has spent the last four seasons expanding his game. The renowned home run hitter was committed to adding layers to his game. Pierce wanted to be an intermediate threat, which meant mastering the entire route tree: curls, slants, outs, the works. With one overriding caveat: [...]

items.title: Alec Pierce is no longer just a deep threat. He's become an all-around receiver, and the Colts are making the most of it
items.summary: Alec Pierce is currently on pace for over 1,000 receiving yards this season, but he only has two receptions for longer than 45 yards.

items.title: Sauce Gardner, Daniel Jones and a lesson about the NFL Draft
items.summary: Colts defensive backs coach Jerome Henderson did extensive research on Sauce Gardner in 2022, while head coach Shane Steichen scouted Daniel Jones in 2019. Neither coach was with the Colts at the time, but the work they did three and six years ago has paid off in 2025.
